sentences.sContent: They crossed the mountains and headed for the valleys beyond.
sentences.sCn: 他们翻过山，向更远处的山谷进发。

sentences.sContent: Beyond the river, cattle were grazing.
She drove through Westport, and stopped a few miles beyond at a wayside inn.
sentences.sCn: 她驱车穿过西港，在几英里外的一个路边旅馆停了下来。

sentences.sContent: ...my appreciation to you is beyond words...
...my heartfelt gratitude to you is beyond words...
...Most people of Elizabethan times did not continue beyond grammar school; so...
...Jobs could have reshaped industries beyond computing...
...Make sure you check in with your opponents so that they are not carrying the emotion of the battles beyond the battle field...
...a hold extending far beyond their literary content...
...But sugar is toxic beyond its calories...
...regulating sugar will prove particularly tricky because it goes beyond health concerns; sugar...
...The idea of “a green campus” is beyond a green environment...

exam.question: Finding a job in such a big company has always been _______ his wildest dreams.

answer.explain: beyond dream： 超乎想象。句意： 能在这样一个大公司找到一份工作一直是他不敢想象的事。其余三项皆不能与dream搭配表达句子意思。

exam.question: We take our skin for granted until it is burned ______ repair.

answer.explain: beyond repair：  不能修复。句意：  在皮肤被烧得无法复原之前， 我们都对它的存在不以为然。 take... for granted：  认为…理所当然。其余三项不符。

synos.tran: 超过；越过；那一边；在...较远的一边

phrases.pCn: [主英国口语]极远的地方；天涯海角；穷乡僻壤，僻远的地区，极偏僻的地方，内地(尤指澳大利亚内陆的荒野地带)

remMethod.val: “不一样的” → 不一样自然就越出其他的 → 越出； 香港红极一时的乐队“Beyond”就是这个词

trans.tranOther: on or to the further side of something
